fields.description: Manages specific departments or teams. Has oversight over certain areas and can manage users within those areas.

The CEO oversees the entire organization, sets strategic goals, and makes high-level decisions. They have access to all areas of the application, can view and manage company-wide analytics and reports, and can approve major changes and updates.

The CFO handles the financial aspects of the company. They manage finance teams, review and approve budgets and financial plans, and oversee payment processing and transaction data. They have access to financial data and reports.
The COO manages the day-to-day operations of the company. They oversee operations teams, view and manage ride data and performance metrics, and approve operational changes and improvements.

The CTO is responsible for the technical direction of the company. They manage development teams, oversee system architecture, and approve technical changes and deployments. They have access to all technical areas of the application.

The BDA focuses on business development and expansion. They manage business development teams, view and manage partnership and expansion data, and review and approve business development plans and proposals.
Analysts analyze data and provide insights. They access analytics and data reporting tools, view and analyze company-wide performance metrics, and create and share reports with executive roles.

Developers build and maintain the application. They have access to development tools and environments, review and manage code and technical documentation, and deploy updates and changes to the application.
Reviewers ensure content and features meet the platform's standards. They review and approve content and features submitted by others before publication.
